Items.name: Page header
Items.Item: Monteverde Plants: Acnistus arborescens

Items.name: Sim Species with desc
Items.Item: ?Lacks the tomato leaf odor characteristic of many solanaceous species. Most individuals have at least some leaves with small wart-like galls caused by mites.?

Items.name: Species
Items.Item: arborescens

Items.name: Abundance
Items.Item: Common at 1000-1400 m, less abundant at higher and lower elevations.

Items.name: Author
Items.Item: (L.) Schltdl.

Items.name: Comments
Items.Item: Because of its habitat and distinctive features, this species is hard to confuse with any other tree.

Items.name: Credits
Items.Item: Images and text copyright © 2002-2005 by William A. Haber, www.cs.umb.edu/efg.

Items.name: Description
Items.Item: Small to medium-sized tree, reproductive at 2-10 m; bark beige, corky with deep virtical ridges and fissures; leaves alternate, often not paired, to 25 cm long, glabrous, elliptic, entire, often with small wart-like galls; flowers white in dense fasciles in leaf axils or at leafless nodes, bell-shaped, 1 cm long, with 5 recurved lobes, green-spotted inside, anthers cream, fragrant; fruit a 7 mm orange juicy berry with many small flat seeds.

Items.name: Family
Items.Item: Solanaceae

Items.name: Family common name
Items.Item: Potato Family

Items.name: Flowering habit
Items.Item: Acni_arbo-hfl-184.jpg#Acni-arbo-fl-o2-72.jpg

Items.name: Genus
Items.Item: Acnistus

Items.name: Habitat
Items.Item: Open areas such as roadsides, old pastures, and young secondary forest.

Items.name: Identification
Items.Item: ? small tree with corky, fissured, beige bark ? large simple leaves, rarely paired, often with wart-like galls ? 1 cm white bell-shaped flowers in sessile groups ? small orange berries

Items.name: Local distribution
Items.Item: Common in disturbed areas from 700 to 1500 m on the Pacific slope; rarely cultivated on Atlantic slope.

Items.name: Phenology
Items.Item: Flower: jan-feb, may-jun. Fruit: may-sep. Some individuals can be found in flower at any time.

Items.name: Pollinators
Items.Item: Small insects including bees, wasps, flies, butterflies, beetles, and ocasionally hummingbirds.

Items.name: Scientific name
Items.Item: Acnistus arborescens

Items.name: Seed dispersers
Items.Item: The fruits are eaten by more than 40 species of birds.

Items.name: Species range
Items.Item: Mexico to Costa Rica; Ecuador and Peru.

Items.name: Voucher
Items.Item: Haber 462
